text: Marshmallow and Choc Chip Banana Boat Choose this recipe idea if you're a chocolate, marshmallow, and banana lover; it's an easy snack or dessert for you! Just be aware that this is a hot banana version. Begin by preheating the oven to 375 °F (191 °C). Get a banana, and cut the hard part at the top off.  Cut the peel about ⁄2 inch (1.3 cm) wide down the middle like a canoe, but do not cut it off! Leave one end open but the other one closed. If you do cut off the flap, just place it back on top and aluminum foil it back on like tape. Open the tab. Scoop out about half of the banana deep out of the bottom of the flap. Add mini chocolate chips and mini marshmallows to the hole.  Put the flap back on top over the fillings.  Wrap in aluminum foil.  Place in a oven-safe dish or on a cookie sheet, and then put it into the oven. You can also do this over hot coals at a campfire. Bake for 12-15 minutes.  Remove banana.  Unpeel the banana carefully. Be careful peeling the skin off for it will be hot! Enjoy the banana boat for dessert.  Healthy Tasty Banana Boat Choose this version for a simple and healthy dessert. When teaching children how to cook, this easy recipe can be taught to them as one of the first things they make in the kitchen. This is a cold banana dessert or snack. Prepare the strawberries. Wash and hull the strawberries. Cut into slices. Prepare the banana. Peel the banana. Using a butter knife, slice the banana lengthwise. Place onto the serving plate. Note: This is a good recipe for learning basic knife cutting skills using a butter knife, and the sooner that a child learns to handle such tools properly, the sooner you will know that the child is able to use them safely, instead of instilling the fear of such use in your child. Add a scoop of the frozen yogurt into the middle of the banana.  Add the strawberry slices over the top of the frozen yogurt.  Sprinkle with the roasted sunflower seeds. The banana boat healthy dessert is now ready to set sail for the dessert table!
